text:
First time eating authentic Cuban food. We will be coming back for sure next time in Vegas. Try the tasting plate which has three meats, salad, platanos and black beans and rice.  My wife had the Cubano sandwhich with pork. My son had the pollo y arroz. 
The portions are large for my gordo friends like Juan V.and Trevor T.

Pros: singer was very good, waitresses were attentive, food was good

Cons: location away from strip but not that far by car at all,  dark area outside by parking area feels unsafe, 

Sample platter was delicious

Amazing service, amazing food. I'm Puerto Rican and cant find a place out here that serves food like home. Its amazing how similar the taste is. Will be bringing my grandparents in to enjoy some good food.

The food was ok. Not bad but not good. I ate the vaca frita. I've honestly had better vaca frita but that's just me. I liked that it was quiet and they had tvs so I could watch the baseball game. But the one closest to me was super dim. The waitress apologized about it so that was cool. Honestly the best thing that I ate there was the chips and salsa. I probably would go back but it was a little over priced in my opinion.
I want to order everything on the menu. I tried the mojitos, tostones with ceviche, papas rellenos, Cuban sandwich, and chicken empanada. Everything was delicious. Can't wait to go back!

I've only been here once, but the cuban sandwhich I ordered was great.  We went during the lunch hour and there were only a few people there so that was nice.  My star deduction is for the canned soda, seriously, how much does it cost to buy a flippin soda fountain?!!?!?  Pony up!

I absolutely love this place! I can not say anything bad from the toasted buttered bread basket to the ropa vieja. My new favorite is the tostones filled with ropa vieja, I can not rave enough about them. The Avacado salad is my staple, always have to have that on the table. Check out the photos, someone posted a picture of it. 
Yes the decor is very purple, and if that is important to you, check out Havana grill nice decor and drinks but the food is hit or miss.

Just ate here, I ate at the bar and was given prompt and courteous service. You can tell it is a nice mom and pop restaurant. Love the atmosphere, priced well.  The food was amazing. Will definitely be coming here again.

Cuban and can verify THIS is the joint to visit. My abuelos supplied that home cooking no true Cubana can go without and without it I shall not anymore! My wife suprised me here for my birthday and could not have left more satisfied! Platanitos, tostones, ropa vieja and the SANDWICHES, Dios mio, the sandwiches. I cannot wait to visit again. Staff is genuine, menu is phenomenally delicious and locale is spotless. Above all, makes you feel 'en casa' (at home)!

Quaint. Great place to go to when you get tired of the busy, fancy, expensive Strip. Small, quiet, clean place, with free parking on site. A busline runs on the street right across. They have a little outdoor sitting area. We went one evening in mid February. They play soft Cuban music inside. Candles on the table. We were attended to and food served just in time. The staff have Spanish/Cuban accent, dressed simply but appropriately. Food was superb, even better than a Cuban place we went to in Manhattan. Big portions. Inexpensive for what it is. We loved it. We will go back to LV just to eat here again. Highly recommended if you like Cuban cuisine, and a place simple and quaint.
Love this place.. Always get the arroz con pollo, and it's perfect. Can't get enough.
Great food, great service a must stop if your here in Vegas and some home cooked flavor

Amazing Cuban food here, with lovely staff and great vibe. We had the sopa de polls, which was fantastic.  Also the mixed cerviche,  fried sweet plantains, empanadas,  and Luchas asado, was all so delicious! 

We are planning to go back before we leave las Vegas!

We drove by the restaurant and decided to stop in for a late lunch with our two daughters. 

The waitress was very, very friendly and the food came quickly. The complimentary bread was outstanding and better than the bread at other area Cuban restaurants we've dined at recently. 

My wife had a sampler plate with the ropa vieja, pork, and chicken. I had the Cuban sandwich. This was some of the best Cuban food we've had outside of and including Florida ever. The food was bursting with delicious flavors. It was actually quite unbelievable how good the food was in this restaurant.  I wish we had a Cuban restaurant this great near our home. 

We intend to return again before our Las Vegas visit is complete. We'll try some of the other local Cuban restaurants, but so far this one trumps Florida Cafe, which was also good, but just not as good.

Been coming here for years. The best Cuban food in the city. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. My favorite is the Lechon Asado. The staff is very friendly and always nice. You won't be disappointed.
Bomb food I love this place. I'm always satisfied after eating. At this place. This place gets so busy that it can be some wait o well food is always good

Returned here for lunch with a coworker.  I haven't been here in a while - but I agree with other reviewers that this place is a best kept secret in Las Vegas!  Good cuban food that you won't find anywhere else in town.  For real.  

We were able to use an Entertainment Book coupon and get one meal free, SCORE!  For as many times as I have eaten here without a coupon, it felt very well deserved.  

I seem to always gravitate to the Pan Con Bistec - a steak sandwich on cuban bread with shoestring potato chips on the sandwich!   I ordered a side of black beans, why not??  Where else would you get the best black beans but in a Cuban restaurant!  

They serve complimentary hot cuban bread that is delish!  

All in all, I've never had a subpar experience at Cuba Cafe - and I estimate I've eaten here about 15 times over the past 5 years.

Well my pop wanted to take me and my other 1/2 out for dinner.  I was in the mood for something other than the usual American or Chinese, so I chose Cuban and luckily for us Cafe Cuba is right around the corner.  My pop and I have had a lot of Cuban food being from South Florida, but my other 1/2 never had it..   He got Bistec con papas in a delish gravy with white rice as did my pop.  I had wonderful pork with rice and black beans flavored with bacon. Each entree came with a really nice salad with a great dressing.  It also came with fried Cuban bread slices. My other 1/2 had 2 glasses of dark rich Cuban beer and a Cuban coffee to finish the meal.  We all wanted dessert, but had no room. Everything was seasoned perfectly and cooked perfectly as well. My other 1/2 raved to the owner and the chef about the food and sopped up the remaining sauce with a 2nd basket of bread.  Our bill was under $60 and worth every penny.  We will be back soon !!  Ceviche for me next time !

the Cuba Cafe is now bigger, tougher, stronger, faster!

fyi- croquet sandwich... what an awesome creation!
I order the cuban sandwich and the pan con bistec. The sandwiches were kind of dry and needed a little bit more sauce. The fried bananas with garlic sauce on the other hand were unique and tasty.
This place is clean and cool. I had the Media Noche and the stuffed tostones are to die for. You must try the coffee it's hot and flavorful. The music makes the time fly
Omg! This place is so good!! The staff is friendly and the food is legit! I go to Miami a lot n this place is authentic Cuban food!

It was our first time here and we've had a hankering for Cuban food.  So we ventured off the strip and tried the Cuba Café.  What an excellent choice it was. We started with  beef empanada which had excellent flavor, next time we'll order 2 of those.  The tasting plate was delicious, next time will order just the "old clothes" as it was so great tasting. The rack of lamb was very well seasoned and plenty of food. The plantains and black beans and rice were wonderful. The tiramisu was average.  
This is a wonderful restaurant, next time we'll remember to ask for the bread that I read about, they must of forgot to give us ours. 
We'll definitely be back the next time in town!
Love this place! They're food is amazing and authentic. The restaurant is a bit older and can use an upgrade in decor. But overall the food is delicious!
I love this place, great service and best cuban food in vegas. I would love to take the cook to my house lol, i cant say it enough, LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE.

Friendly, cozy restaurant on eastside.  Have been multiple times and always get the croquetas de jamon for starters.  Flavor and crispness is always spot on and before you know it they are all gone, wishing you had just one more on the plate to indulge in.  For a real special treat try their lemonade that has a large frothy head on it.  Won't see this too often so enjoy and go back for more.

It looks cuban... it smells like cuban's cuisine but it definitely DOES NOT! taste like cuban food (and i know cause I'm cuban and have been eating cuban food since i got my teeth over 30 yrs ago).       

This is my second time visiting Vegas, we come from Tampa FL and we eat cuban food all the time and I was ready to try different stuff but after eating sushi the night before, my husband was ready for "real food" so we went here and we were very disappointed... 

The place is nice, location not too bad and not having to worry about where to park was good but i am 99.9% sure that the cook is not cuban.

If you don't really know the difference between a good cuban dish and a not so good I guess you'll be pleased, but if you do then I suggest you go else where

PS: stay away from the Tamales Criollos... Not good at all!  All you can taste is the seasoning instead of the corn.
First time here and I highly recommend coming in!  Staff was extremely welcoming and diligent with service at all times....food was authentic and PHENOMENAL!!!!!

I have rarely enjoyed a meal more.  The food, the service and the ambience was excellent on our visit.  I will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas!  And next time it will be when the bad in playing!

Are you ready to hear the craziest story? My father took me to CC for my birthday.  The place was maybe 60% filled to capacity.  I think everyone was getting their food faster than us.  What really sealed the deal was when the waitress came with a plate of food and sat at the table next to us and started eating.  We hadn't got our food yet, everyone around us had got their food and now the waitress was eating her dinner. WTF?  I gave it 3 stars because the food really is great.  The service and speed is what sucks.

Food, service, ambiance, staff - everything about this place is just awesome. I have never seen restaurant staff so friendly and caring. My mom was a little down with a cold on one of our visits there, and our waitress made her a special drink with honey and lime. That kind of warmth just touches the heart. On another visit of ours on a Christmas day, they were hosting a private party, but still allowed us. We were touched by their service and warmth at every visit. We are not from the area, but whenever we are at Vegas, we make sure to pay a visit to the Cuba Cafe.

On a quick trip to Vegas, we were craving Cuban food.  Cuba Cafe was the closest restaurant to us that had pretty good reviews.  Definitely glad we checked this place out.  The food was great, reasonably priced and very friendly service.  If you're cool with eating at an off-strip location, go to Cuba Cafe.  You won't be disappointed!

This place is the bomb!!! Place is very authentic and food is excellent! The staff is super friendly and helpful, and service is great! The owner usually comes in also and helps greet and assists customers.  The ceviche is awesome, try this when you come and you will know why. Freshest ingredients are used and you can taste the difference in the food, all of which is made to order.  The steaks, ropa vieja and the paella/arroz con Mariscos is to die for!  Just full of flavor and serving is great!    I've had the Cuban sandwiches here too and it's yummy!  Been coming here for years since it was a tiny place and now it's grown and definitely worth it!!!! Definitely the best Cuban place in town!

I had been driving around looking for a Thai Restaurant for about an hour when I noticed the one next door to the Cuba Cafe.  One glance and I knew that I would skip the Thai and come here instead!  It's small, but it's a family owned and operated place where everyone is happy and friendly, the service was GREAT for me, and the food was delicious and at a VERY REASONABLE PRICE!  I had a daily special of a tilapia dish with almond sauce served with a salad and Cuban rice, dessert of a wonderful flan, and a beer for $20!  I'LL COME RUNNING BACK, with friends in tow, if possible.
Not the best Cuban food I have had ... the lady forgot some of our oder and overpriced for what we got ... i will not come back ...

This is the fourth time I have visited this place and the last.  If you go, do not
order margaritas.  I ordered a top shelf and it was the worst margarita I have ever had.  First, it was in a martini glass that was full of ice.  The mix was so artificial tasting and I could not taste any tequila.  When I pointed this out to the waitress, she just 
shrugged her shoulders.  What customer service!
We ordered a number of tapas, which were overpriced and mediocre at best.
The entrees were the same.
The service was quite bad and so was the food.

We interacted with Cuba Cafe, as they were moving to their larger, current location.  I visited their soon to be new location and purchased a few pieces of restaurant equipment.  A young Mexican couple, *name redacted*, were working for the owner of Cuba Cafe and the Landlord, and Owners of Sergio's Italian Restaurant, Across the street, Mr. Napoli and his Daughter.  The restaurant was absolutely filthy.  There were roaches and grease everywhere.  The couple were on their hands and knees cleaning and scraping, with grease and rotten food covering their bodies and faces.  
         They told me that they are homeless and that they have lived and will live in the restaurant, until they finish cleaning it up and repainting it.  They explained to me that Cuba Cafe had not paid them for any of the work.  After complaining to the Landlord they were told, by the Landlord, in my presence, that he would pay them with the old broken greasy equipment that they were able to clean up, regardless of what Cuba Cafe does.  Basically, they can keep the equipment fix it and sell it.  I decided that I would help them move and clean up the equipment, outside of the restaurant.  I was well aware that they could not sell the equipment, in this condition, and that it would take a few months to be sold.  
          We rented a large u - haul truck.  We were in the processes of moving the equipment onto the truck when the owner of Cuba Cafe, *name redacted*, brought over the Landlord and told the couple that he made a new deal with the Landlord for some of the equipment, *the desirable pieces that worked*, and that they were evicted immediately, for continuing to complain about getting paid, that if they don't leave the property the police will be called.  

          They were not paid, and were once again homeless.  I let them borrow the u haul until they could find a place to store the few pieces of damaged nasty equipment that they were allowed to keep.  After 2 days, they could not find a place to store the equipment and were living in the u haul.  I ended up storing the equipment for them for a year.  They were given a key to the storage unit.  They never came back and I don't know what happened to the married couple.  I have not spoken with them since.  

          You can't hire people, without pay!  That is slavery.  I don't care if they were drug addicts, criminals, or etc.  I'm sitting here tearing up thinking about what they did to these good people.  If you have money, pay the poor what they deserve.  These people did a very good job cleaning up his restaurant.  If you've been there, just remember who cleaned it up.  They did an amazing job.  They should have been paid, not thrown out.

This restaurant is "A-OK."  Not spectacular, but not bad.  Had the Bistec de Palomilla (top sirloin) and bf had the Filetillo Salteado (top sirloin with garlic, onions and bell peppers), and both were decent.  The rice and beans and empanada were pretty good.  Overall, everything could have used a little less salt, and prices are a tad high for what you get.  If you only have a few days in Vegas, I'd say try a different restaurant instead.

We decided to try something different and found Cuba Cafe through the internet. To our surprise, cuban food was pretty good. My husband ordered a salmon with diced mango. Very yummy. I ordered chicken marinated with lime, butter and onion. Not bad. You will love their lightly toasted bread! Cant stop eating these bread and keep asking for another round of bread. :)

I have been eating here for years and the food never disappoints.  My favorites are the cuban sandwich, platanos maduros (fried bananas), croquetas(ham and beef croquettes) and carne con papas (tender beef with potatoes).  I usally have a Mamey flavored Batido (cuban style milkshake) with my meal.  Very satisfying.

The portions are a good size, the food delicious and the service awesome.

GIve them a try.  You won't be disappointed.

Nice restaurant with friendly staff and great food. I decided to get the taster plate so I could try as many things as possible. I liked everything on the plate, but I absolutely loved the ropa vieja. I could have eaten only this and been happy. For starters we had the bruschetta and ceviche. Both were excellent. Our waitress was so nice. I will be coming back for more.

In Las Vegas when it comes to authentic Cuban restaurants, Cuba Cafe is as good as it gets. A hole in the wall place located on Tropicana. Not far off from the strip and UNLV, this place has been in service for quite some time. I usually go to Grandma's house for Cuban food but if I'm in the mood for a cuban sandwich and just feel like dining out, this is the place I hit up. It is pricey so be aware! Walking in and dining, you probably won't be enthused about the decor but the food is worth the experience. I have experienced in some cases a long wait for food, but I still keep going back.

As other reviewers have said, the Cuba Cafe is not an easy place to find so make sure you know the approximate location before you head out. When you enter the dining room, you'll notice two things: 1. the homey Cuban decor (notwithstanding the poster of Dirty Dancing - Havana Nights); 2. everyone is speaking Spanish. This is not a fancy restaurant, and somehow that inspires confidence as soon as you walk in. Every table gets a basket of grilled bread with butter - simple and delicious. The platanos maduros (sweet fried bananas aka plantains) were flavorful and not too oily. The lechon asado (marinated pork leg) is on the menu cover for good reason. It is famazing. The pork was very tender and succulent. That said, I can not recommend the sandwich cubano. I don't know if it's because I can't appreciate it or I've simply had better (Paseo in Seattle), but it was quite plain. I was expecting more punch especially when compared to the lechon asado. But, I think the entrees are Cuba Cafe's strength, and I will definitely be back. Service was good despite our lack of Spanish communication. Try the Cuban sodas!

Tried this place today and absolutely loved it! The service was good, staff was very friendly and attentive. As for the food, the ceviche was the best I've ever had and the Cuban sandwich was delicious. Will definitely be back for more!

Never been to Cuba but you can tell that this food is authentic....I love Cuban food and this was fantastic! 
Great service as well! Will definitely come back!
Food was delicious, and made from scratch. It was quiet and the customer service was good. Friendly waitresses.

I am Puerto Rican, and our food is quite similar to Cuban food. When I'm craving some good ole Criollo eatin' and my mom's not in town, I know that Cuba Cafe will fulfill my craving and leave me fat and happy and full. There are a few Cuban restaurants in Las Vegas but this one is by far the best. It's small, homey, nothing fancy, but the servers are super nice and attentive and the food is fresh and flavorful and plentiful. It's a bit slow to come out of the kitchen, but you can't rush greatness. The wait is definitely worth it, especially with a basket of warm, crusty bread and a delicious mojito. I recommend their arroz con pollo with a side of red beans and tostones. For a light lunch their Cubano sandwich is excellent. Anyone who doesn't like this place doesn't know what good Criollo food is.

Having recently moved to Las Vegas from Orlando, Florida where affordable Cuban and Puerto Rican food is plentiful, we had our fingers crossed that on a Saturday Night Cuba Cafe would serve up some much craved Latino comfort food. 

Great quality food, definitely had a "made from scratch" feeling. Everything tasted really fresh and if we'd made it ourselves. My only critique would be : More Flavor. This was the mildest flavored Latin food I've ever tasted. Where's the big bold garlic kick? I really missed it. We will be back for the friendly, attentive service and great quality food and value ( portions are huge ). 

Bonus: The live entertainment duo were phenomenal !
Got take out today.  Sandwiches are solid and plantains are worth getting.  Fries crispy 20min later.  Will repeat.

Hands down the best Cuban food in the city. I have eaten here many times and the food is always awesome, the service is spot on my only problem is I fell in love with the yuca and crocrettas and can't force myself into trying other appetizers. I have the same issue with the entree.  If you enjoy Cuban food you really need to try this place. If you never had Cuban food you really need to check this place out if your tired of the same old things.

I been coming here for the last 10 years and the quality of food, service and environment are the best. This is authentic Cuban food and by far, the best in Town. I've been to many others and this is the cleanest Cuban place.

I've only had Cuban a few times, but I really liked the food here. I find the food on the bland side compared to some other cuisines, but very good. We had the Plantanos Maduros $2.50 (sweet bananas), fried perfectly, and yummy. We had sandwiches, Chicken Chipolte $7.95, which wasn't very hot or spicy, but still very good. The bread is flattened and grilled crisp with mayo, lettuce and tomato. The Chicken sandwich $7.50, is marinated and mild tasting. 
I liked the decor, especially the wine corks in the ceiling.
Great empanadas!  The rest of the food is yummy too.  Waiter and everyone overall is very nice.  Thank you!

Love love love the empanadas!!! All of the food was delicious. We got the two tasting plates. The pork literally melted it was so tender. My mom loved the "old rag" meat dish. The waitress was really patient and a sweetheart. Plantains were perfect! 

The flan/tres leches pineapple dish was a major disappointment and I hate the location but otherwise yum yum!
The service was ok! Angie at the bar was great. The food was a little grease... too much oil.

Even mom was surprised at how good their Fricase de Pollo, and black beans were - she is a top rated cuban chef.  We have been coming to Vegas for family reunions for longer than I would like to admit, and if you crave good cuban food in a relaxed atmosphere - this is your stop. The service is super friendly, and always very helpful with disabled visitors (mom).  The combo flan/tres leche dessert along with the mamey shake will make you forget about all the cash you have left in Vegas.  I miss their old smaller intimate location, but this new larger location alllows for larger groups.

The service is great and the food is awesome. Given that I know my cuban food, it is true to its roots. Amazing bread!!! I ordered the tasting plate and the croquetes and they didn't disappoint. I am definitely coming back for more.
We've eaten here before. Big servings good good. Friendly staff. Had birthday lunch here couple of times. Parking lot always full.

Great Food. little longer than usual wait time but, worth i,t food was prepared excellently....... best Flan and Tres Leches Dessert taste nothing like the store-bought stuff and the maracuya drink was delicious

This is not Cuban food. The coffee was horrible and the croquetas had a mixture of beef and ham?!? Maybe I'm biased having been raised in Miami but the only authentic Cuban tasting item was the complimentary bread they provided as an appetizer.

Good food.
Vaca frita was very good. 
Good atmosphere.
Fast service.
Over all good place to grab a bite.

I wish I could give Cuba Café a higher grade, but the service really brought it down. At 2:30 on a Saturday, we were the only customers in the place, and while I know that's a slow time, it seems like we should therefore have had BETTER service, not worse! It took a while to order, and after we did, we had to chase down the servers several times to get refills on our drinks.

While the service was poor, the food was pretty good. Three of my friends had Cuban sandwiches, and--surprisingly--it was the first time for two of them! All three loved them, and I'm glad they now know the power of the Cuban! A fourth friend had the chicken sandwich, which was nothing special; and my husband had the daily deal: pork bruschetta, which was a skewer of tasty marinated pork with peppers and onions. Yum!

I got the tasting plate, which at $16.95 was one of the more expensive items on the menu, but it had an abundance of traditional favorites: ropa vieja (beef), puerco asado (pork), and pollo Grand Marnier (chicken) with rice and beans, sweet plantains, and a nicely dressed lettuce salad. Loved the beef and sides, but the pork and chicken were a bit overdone. I also had a mojito, which was heavy on the mint--but also heavy on the booze!

Overall, I would try Cuba Café again, but maybe on a different day or at a different time. (Or maybe they were just having an off day...)

If you are looking for authentic delicious Cuban food, then this is definitely the place! This food is sooo good you will be coming back for more. My daughters and I had dinner there. We had the Vaca Frita. The food came out hot, on time, and it was seasoned to perfection! The ambience was impeccable because Cuba Café has a lot of personality to it unlike a lot of chain restaurants. We will definitely be back again!

The Food was great and was not over priced.. The staff was more than gracious.. I have not had great service like this for a while.. The Cubano Sandwich I crave.. I lived in FL for many years and have had only the best Cuban food,, The Cubano is spot on traditional.. fabulous

This is the third year in a row that I have popped into this place for a bite and once again, they have providing and excellent meal. I brought a few friends along and they were all surprised at how great this place was. A very pleasant break from being on the strip. Thank you again.

This was my first time trying this place and the environment was very welcoming. They have live music playing so it is a little loud but, they have tables that are far away from the band as well as super close to the band. The food was delicious and I would recommend this place for anyone looking for good Cuban food !

The food had a good taste, but the pork sandwich I got was as much fat as it was meat.  My stomach was upset the rest of the day.  And I thought it was kind of ridiculous to charge $8 for a sandwich that comes with NOTHING.  Who sells a sandwich with absolutely zero sides??   Probably won't go back - too many other places that are better value and more edible.

Went to a late lunch based on yelp reviews and my love of Cuban food. Kinda worried when I saw the hubby and I were the only customers but in we went. 
The complimentary bread was warm, crispy yet soft, and buttered goodness! I could just eat it all day but I had to make myself stop and save room for my "tasting plate."
So, the tasting plate ($14.95) has 3 different Cuban dishes: ropa vieja, pollo tequila, and lechon asado. Served nice and piping hot, with rice mixed with black beans, a mixed greens salad with vinaigrette dressing, and fried plantains. Heavenly! Rich flavors in the beef and pork that blend nicely. The chicken was not as rich but still yummy. The meat was so tender that i just needed to use my fork to cut into it. I stuffed myself! A great price for the amount of food you get. 
Free soda refills and the staff was very nice. I left thoroughly stuffed and happy.
It is a very nice place. Good food and nice friendly staff. I highly recommend it. Traditional Mojito taste so good. The prices are not bad. I suggest trying the ceviche.

We stumbled on Cuba Cafe after another nearby choice wasn't open. Waitstaff was very helpful with recommendations and advice on how much to order. 

For appetizers, the empanadas were great (one chicken and one chorizo) and the pork medallions were really outstanding. The meal was a Cuban sandwich and the roast pork. Sandwich was great, as you'd expect. The roast pork was super tender and exceptionally tasty. 

I will go back

As a Cuban who eats cuban food all the time, this place was a must try on my last trip to Vegas.  One of my relatives recommended it, so I made it a point to try it.  It seemed to be a family run business, which I love.  The service was top great.  The wait staff was on point and we did not have to wait for anything while we were there.  We Made a reservation, but when we arrived there were a few open tables, so we sat right down for dinner.  The brought out some cuban bread for the table which was fantastic!  We ordered the sampler appetizer which was fantastic.  I highly recommend it.  Its like tapas, so you get a little bit of a few cuban traditional apps.    

I ordered the dinner sampler as my main course.  It came with cuban style chicken, pork, and ropa vieja.  The were good, but I've had better.  I didn't care too much for the pork, and that is a bummer as I love cuban pork, but the rest was good.  We ordered some cuban sandwiches to go and had them for lunch the next day.  These were delicious and I would definately come back for more of their sandwiches.

Overall I would say the food is above average, with a few items well above average.  The service is an A+.  will definately be back.

Great food, authentic Cuban food like in Florida! 
 Really a great little place to grab a quick meal, cocktails are great too. They make the best mojitos!

One word LECHON....   Strong... Melts in your mouth with the right amount of spices.  

We found the service awesome and quick.  Many great choices of restaurants in Las Vegas...  This is a great place.  Prices are responsible as well.

Three of us went there just to see what it was like. The place is very nice inside even though the parking lot doesn't look like much. We got there about 6pm, and by the time we left (maybe 7pm?) it was starting to fill up.
There was a special that we later were told was most nights the same. It was a small filet, rice and beans, and the steak was in a pepper sherry sauce. My two friends both got this.
I got the Lechon Asado (pork) with yellow rice. It was to come with beans and rice but they let me substitute the yellow rice. Also served to the table was a kind of warm, puffy bread. Crisp on the outside, and soft and wonderful inside. My pork was tremendous. Couldn't ask for more. I'd recommend NOT getting a side salad (extra cost). We didn't and I'm glad as I was full afterwards.
I did try my friends steaks. Wow! Melt in your mouth nice! I highly recommend both meals. I'm not sure how cuban the steak is, but it was superb.
The steal meal was $15.49 I believe. My pork dish was $15.95. I'll tell you what. I'll definitely be back and recommend that people try this place. Service was a bit slow, especially since it was not crowded, but worth it. Again, it was nice inside. I'd NOT recommend shorts or t-shirt. But jeans and a button up shirt is perfect.

What an amazing find!!! You would never expect such great food in a strip mall. This gem really deserves to be on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. This is the best Cuban food I have had since I left NYC in 1990. I will come back each time I am in Vegas!

Visiting Vegas and wanted to try something different so we went to Cuba Cafe. 
We had the sandwich Cubano, Media-Noche sandwich, an order of tostones, an order of moro rice, and the fried pork tapa which I requested with rice.   
My dining companions had the sandwiches and while the sandwiches were good, they were not stellar.  Have had better sandwiches.  The moros rice was good, but an average good.  Tostones were soft on the inside and crispy on the outside.  Very nice.  The garlic sauce that came with the tostones was not good. It was just the commercial store purchased chopped garlic which doesn't taste the same as fresh garlic. Not a smart way to cut costs. The tapas came with two small pieces of pork and the rice and beans. The two pieces of pork were enough for me but it was not as tasty as I expected it to be. This dish at $8.99 is a bit pricey.  I found the pricing in general to be a little high for the area and the ingredients of the dish.  Let's face it rice, beans and pork are relatively inexpensive.
I don't think Cuba Cafe would be my choice again considering that Las Vegas has several other Cuban spots.
I dont have any basis for comparison since its the only cuban restaurant I've eaten at but the food is always good. Portions are very generous and the staff are nice. The atmosphere is nice too.
This place is awesome. It never disappoints. From the lemonade to the "old dirty clothes!" everything about it screams Habana!

We had reservations for a party of 6 on a Friday night. Did not need reservations. Live music was very good and quiet enough we could still hear people at our table. Service was okay. We had to ask waitress several times for refills on drinks. 
Food was excellent.  We shared tapas and then we each had different main dishes from all sections of the menu. Mahi Mahi with cilantro and lemon was fresh and clean tasting. Pasta Cuba Cafe with chicken and peanut butter sauce was a little spicy and very filling. The tasting plate was huge. Masitas de Puerco was well received. The lemonade was fantastic!

Visit Las Vegas frequently. It was my sons birthday and being we wanted to have a nice dinner after a long drive we decided to give this place a try.  I miss grandmas cooking and the menu looked close to some old familiar dishes. 
  Service was excellent it was a Friday night and there was dancing and the entertainment was good.  The atmosphere was lively but not obnoxious.  

We ordered a few drinks and sangria all good excellent variety to choose from, we had several different dishes and the food was well prepared and i even placed an order to go so i could have tostones y juevos for breakfast....they tasted awesome the next day by the way.  Food was awesome and after dinner they presented my son a nice mini cake for his birthday.  The prices are fair for food some of the liquor choices can be pricey but excellent selection. My daughter raved about the cuba libre and another selection.  Only regret is not getting some salsa dancing in but I recommend the place for food service and sangria.  Also at home in California very difficult to find cocina criolla and it was a nice walk back down memory lane.

Our first time for Cuban Food. Purple curtains and low lighting may scare off some, but not us! Friendly, attentive and polite staff. We tried Cubano Sandwich --- may not look like much, but was delish, oozing with Cheese and perfect with pickles. The Tasting Menu was a perfect taste of all their specialties. The meats were so soft! 
Everything was good ... Just not super great.
Great food!  The food was as good as any Cuban place I've ever been to in Miami.  I recommend the Tasting Plate!

Make it a 3 plus, actually.  I had a Cuban sandwich (roast pork, ham, swiss cheese and pickles on a roll) and a mamey milkshake.  The sandwich tasted homemade--like something my grandmother might have made (even though she was English, not Cuban), with tender, well-done roast pork.  The mamey shake was a little bland, but never having had mamey before, I had to try it.  I assume that's the way mamey is, and it was soothing and cooling, so the bland wasn't a total negative.  Think sort of an apricot-peach-tropical shake that is meant to be good for you, and you have an idea how it tastes.  Service was fine, but I was the only customer in the place.  I'd try this place a second time when I have a bigger appetite.
Great service, delicious food. Try the "Tasting Plate" for a little of everything, but also make sure you order an empanada!

This place is awesome! I started drinking a "papaya batido" and trying the "platanos maduros" as appetizer. They were so delicious. As entree, I had a "picadillo plate", it's meat with vegetables, and comes with salad, rice and beans - overall, very tasteful, but the beans were to die for. Great service. I will definitely be back.

Searched for a Cuban place in the area and found this great place. Very friendly and attentive staff. Large menu with a lot of interesting choices. We started with the sampler appetizer and had a great empanada, ham & cheese croquette, and beef croquette with fried plantains, all excellent. I had the chicken tequila which was very good, although obviously previously frozen chicken breast, a little dry, but tasty with excellent yellow rice. We also had the mahi-mahi and creamed spinach. I don't like fish, but was told it was excellent and not fishy at all. The creamed spinach was good. We also tried one fo the pork dishes which was excellent as well. I would still come back to try some of the other dishes.....I would like to give the ropa a try as its one of my favorites. Most of the dishes were around $15 which I would consider a good deal.
The food was AMAZING! The coco and mango mojito  where to die for! My husbands pollo al Ajillo was great  as was my veggie sandwich! Great place!

Let me start by saying the food was delicious we had the Cuban sandwich and churasco cubano. I gave this place 3 stars due to the lack of customer service, we came here to celebrate a few things Father's Day, two birthdays and my sister getting a house. The waitress that waited on us was rude and unpleasant, not a smile or anything that made it seem that she enjoyed her job let alone that she wanted to be there. That pretty much ruined my experience here and won't come back.

Great food. We've been to a bunch of Cuban restaurants in the past from Colorado to Florida and I would say that this one rates up there with the Miami Cuban places. Food was delicious and the price was great. I had the Sample Plate and it did not disappoint. My wife had the Carne con Papas and the meat was so moist and tasty. I would definitely recommend for anyone looking for good meal off the strip.

DELICIOUS AND OUTSTANDING SERVICE. I had never had Cuban food and tried the tappa appetizer with a mix of foods and the meat sampler meal with plantains and smoky rice and black beans. I now know I LOVE Cuban food. So worth a stop by. Prices are very reasonable also.

Supper happy I decided to step in!! This place is great and I will be recommending it to all my friends, family, clients!! The authenticity of the food is mouth watering, can't wait for my next visit!

Gotta get my Cuban food fix- very cute place off the strip...Lichen Asado, tops Vieja, pollo tequila & rice y beans, plantains y yucca mojo
very much ok

Cuban food is not one of the cuisines I crave, but friends have clued me in that Cuba Cafe is the top spot in town for legit eats. I was warned not to go for the Cuban sandwich though, because that's pretty standard anywhere- come here for more adventurous dishes.

The sampler plate is a good option, with four different meats to figure out which you like. The spicy stewed pork dish was my favorite, but the shredded beef was good too. A thick sliced pork was on the dry side. And I've never really been into maduros. Solid intro option.
But really keep an eye on the specials- came in and found Pork Bruschetta one day and it was flipping fantastic. Two skewers of grilled pork with veggies, like a cuban take on kabobs, over a flavorful rice with a tomato-based sauce. Everything was full of flavor and the meat had a great smokey taste to it. Bonus points for siding this with a light salad with crunchy cabbage and a slightly sweet dressing, which really complemented the heavier main dish. Wish this was on the regular menu!

Cuba Cafe is a great leisurely lunch option. An evening visit will treat you to live music and dancing, but I prefer to converse. Full bar available.
Love their cuban sandwich. First time at the new, bigger location and it is still as good as the old spot.
A little slow service, but good quality items.
Food excellent!  Croquetas was so good this is a must if you are looking for awesome Cuban food!  The desserts are awesome as well paired with Cuban lemonade !!!!
Still consistent and good!!!! I have NO idea why someone could rate this resturant low. It's the best Cuban food in town.

Now I know why Cubans are always so happy, dancing and singing!



When you bite into the crispy golden tostones topped with mojo, you will sing.

When the Ropa Vieja simmering in a mouthwatering sauce, cooked to perfection, melts in your mouth, you will dance.

Outstanding flavors in the Moros Cristianos...
Maduros?  These Caramelized Plantains will drive you crazy!  

Lechon Asado, I don't even want to tell you want you might do after tasting this.  Delicious, Delicious, Delicious!

I had the Tasting Platter, and a side of tostones.  The food was outstanding, and the service couldn't have been better.

So far, this is by far one of my all time favorite restaurants.  Thank you.

Delicious food, great & friendly service. My hubby had lamb & it was so tender. I ordered a chicken dish in a mushroom sauce with yellow rice. It was delicious as well. The staff is friendly & service was good. I will be back.
Awesome customer service. The Cubano sandwich was good. Not the best I've ha but very good. Ambience is very desirable and they even had musical numbers.

I gave this restaurant five stars before. The only reason I gave it a four star now its because there new bathrooms at the new location needed some attention.  It took longer to get our order this time.  They didn't ask us if we wanted the tab split knowing there were two couples. Made it akward when we had to split the tab.  They need to hire another waitress even though the one they have now is pretty good but she might need some help on the busy hours now.  The food is still the same! WONDERFUL!  Love it.  They did raise a couple dollars here and there but the porpotions where still the same.  We will always hit this restaurant we just hope they keep improving for the better.
Really good! Great Cuban food in Vegas. The lechon was delicious. The place is cute and very clean.

Every year we go to Vegas for the holidays, and every year I make it a point to come here.  I have loved everything I have tried, the lechon asado, the bistec, the chicken, and most of all the ropa vieja.  Dishes come with "moros y christianos" the black beans and rice side dish that would be a wonderful meal all by itself.
The service is good, attentive but not overbearing, they fill your water or drink glass as needed, gently inquire if everything is satisfactory, and hover in the background waiting to fulfill any need.
The buttered toasty bread brought to the table to start is also quite good.
For dessert we had the flan, and I was also very happy with that, a perfect creamy, caramel flavor bomb.
We have a cuban place in San Diego that I visit, but this one is worth a trip of 300 miles just for the delicious food.
I love this place. I call for pick up on my way home from work. Love the beef empanadas and Cuban sandwiches. Good prices. Nice staff.

So delicious. My husband and I never had Cuban food before but after watching cooking shows we wanted to try a Cuban sandwich. We split it and a sampler player. We were not disappointed. And the price was not bad at all.

Good food at this joint. I've been here a few times with my friends to socialize and enjoy good food. I'm kinda familiar with foods but I had to ask my friend what it was lol. I ordered lechon sandwich, the meat was so tender and the bread was fresh. 
They have some awesome milkshakes at this place, they have the classic vanilla, strawberry and chocolate. I went with an exotic fruit milkshake, I do have to say it was different tasting to what my pallet is used to.

Simply put, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Really good Cuban food, reasonable prices, and great staff.

My go to is the Cuban sandwich. A traditional favorite and boy is it good... And it's enough for two to share. I'll often call in my order and pick it up when I'm out and about. 

Even if it's out of your way, stop by. It's worth your time.
Very nice place. Simple but nice environment, good service and food is excellent. Highly recommend the ceviche and Argentinian steak.

Food, ok. 

Services, ok. 

Atmosphere, sucks.  The decor is stuck in the 1970s, and needs a major overhaul.  Felt like I was sitting at a truck stop.
Came here for noche buena and it was amazing! My family is Cuban and we all grew up in Miami and all agree that this is one of the best Cuban places we've ever eaten at

I was really impressed by the way the food was prepared for carry out delivery.  All of the drinks had tape over the straw opening. The moccachino Frappe was unreal.  I could taste the flavor of real coffee.  Would choose this over any Starbucks Frappuccino any day.  The picadillo was delicious and so was the white rice and black beans that came along with it.  The arroz con gandules was ok.  Didn't realize it had pork or meat in it otherwise I would not have ordered.  Was a little cakey in consistency but perhaps it was because it was delivered.  Also ordered the plantain flambé dessert which was delicious.  Only drawback is that you get a lot more ice cream than actual sweet plantains so for the price I'm not sure if you actually get your money's worth. I can't wait to try this place and actually eat in the dining room because I'm sure it's 10x better.
Good place to eat an authentic Cuban food. If you live in the west is nothing to envy the Florida guetto

Food was Great, now service would get a Two star, the male server sucked!! I ran out of water during my meal and it never got refilled I had to ask for a refill when they brought me the check. He did not acknowledge our table of two. The place is cute and cozy so don't understand how or why he would overlook us. So if you want Delicious Cuban food order it to go, and don't dine in with your GAY partner.

Simply Amazing! This restaurant will give you foodgasm! It was my first time eating at a cuban restaurant here in Vegas and was surprised there is this secretly hiding wonderful place. Started with the appetizer we ordered the Tapas sampler  platter which had Banana chips,Empanada(Beef),Potato stuffed with beef and deep fried beef stick. They serve it with garlic sauce drizzled in olive oil and another specialty sauce, The items on the plate were just getting better tasting than the other after each bite.For our Entree The "Lechon Asado"(Shredded Pork) was wonderful. I personally ordered the "Ropa Vieja" (Old Rope shredded beef) which is one of my favorite cuban dishes cause it has a similarity to the American "Beef Stew"or "Mechado"  from the Philippines. When it was served to me It didn't have the overflowing sauce that I had expected. But to my amazement as soon as I took a bite of the beef with the "Moros"(rice&beans) It was euphoric. We also tried the "Mame" shake a fruit similar to a "Chico" from the Philippines they both come from the same fruit genome. It was all tremendously delicious!  Try it and you will never regret it!

This is my GO TO place to take visitors from out of town.  I get them off the Strip or from McCarran and head right over.  There's not one person (out of over a dozen) I've taken who doesn't LOVE this place.  It's usually not super swamped, the concrete floor makes it a bit loud, but I don't care.  The servers are vested and lovely.  Perfect English or Spanish, you pick.  The Ropa Vieja is the best I've had, anywhere.  The combo plate is a good one for guests.  They can try the beef, chicken and pork.  If you like bread, you will find the BEST warm butter bread in Vegas (likely west of the Rockies) here.  OMG!!!!!!!  I DARE you to eat just one piece.  You can't.  Yeah, big ups to this place.  Who says that anymore?  I'm old.  Anyway, just GO.  You will LOVE it!
Good cuban food and good service. I would go back if I was in Vegas.

I absolutely love their Ropa Vieja also known as "old clothes."  Thinking about the aromatic blend of spices combined with the shredded beef  that's been simmered to perfection is making my mouth water right now!  

Very reasonable prices and a nice tapas selection as well.  Cuba Cafe is a great place to go eat if you want to avoid the high prices and obnoxious crowds down on the Strip.

You walk in and it feels like you're at a funeral. Dark walls and curtains. Corquette here is amazing. Rice and beans is passable. Vivian sandwich was good but not impressive. Staff was friendly enough.
The food was great and the service was awsome. It was quite and away from the strip.

I've been driving past this place so many time that I finally encouraged my wife to come here for dinner. We have never tried authentic Cuban food so we were pretty excited. We had the following:

Beef Empanada $4.75

Sopa De Pollo $5.50

Chicken Chipotle Sandwich $7.95

Tasting Plate $16.95

The empanada was delicious! It was definitely homemade and fried perfectly with no trace of excess oil. The chicken soup was good but i wish they used fresh veges instead of frozen peas and carrots. My tasting plate consisted of shredded beef, roasted pork, and grilled chicken. It came with rice, beans, and fried bananas. I thought it was really good and enough to share for 2 hungry people. The meats were very flavorful and i loved the fried bananas. My wife said her chicken sandwich was good too. I think this place is very authentic and the food is great.

Grace ordered the Lechon Asado plate, I got the Tasters Plate which was like a sampler of three different meats...both plates were excellent and served with salad greens and black beans and rice and grilled bread! Nice restaurant setting offering live music on the weekends
Amazing! Get the lamb chops and tapas you won't be disappointed. They might treat you different if you don't know Spanish sooo get your game up hungry bitches!

Near Aunt Margie's house so we met Aunt Shirley and Sloan for dinner on a Friday night. Everyone's first time here, two had never eaten Cuban food. I have, but didn't want just a Cuban sandwich. Aunt Margie had a sandwich and she said it was good, but not much meat. She also expected peppers on it, but if they were there, finely chopped and cooked in with meat. I had no idea what I was ordering, but the waitress recommended it and it was named for me--pollo la ajillo. It was breaded chicken and fried served with a very garlicky gravy/sauce. Normally I wouldn't order something breaded and fried, but it was very good and I ate the entire generous portion, which also came with a small perfectly dressed side salad. Aunt Shirley had the avocado salad, which looked like a delicious work of art. Sloan ordered the same thing, but only ate half if it. Glad to take the rest home for another meal. Everyone said they'd come back. That's a pretty good testament to how much we enjoyed it.
Tapas and sangria - a perfect late evening repast  the lamb chops are to die for- if only I could do so well at home.

Hands down!! This is far and above the best Cuban food off the island!!! Every dish was plentiful, delicious and authentic! Not only was the food fantastic, but the service was genuinely kind and appreciative. If you're looking for a great off-strip family-friendly Cuban restaurant, Cuban Cafe is definitely the place!

Was the only white person in there, stared at right away, WHATEVER! my money is jsut as good as the other peoples right?! food was MEH. bread was stale and toasted. not a nice combo. meat wasnt well cut, or seasoned. The fresh flowers were a nice touch, but thats about it.

Gave my wife the option of eating out anywhere today for Mother's Day, a few of our favorite restaurants were already booked solid. So she says let's try Cuban food. We decided on Cuba Cafe based on the reviews.

Everything was great from the food, the mojitos / sangria and the live band. We will definitely visit again. Would have given it 5 stars except the wait on the food was long, but the food was well worth the wait.
Best Cuban food in Las Vegas. Very friendly staff. Authentic traditional Cuban food made to perfection!!
Food was excellent and plentiful. Seasoned well and served hot. Lamb was cooked to perfection. Hope to get back before we leave.

My favorite cuban spot in Las Vegas. 

The pan con croquettas is to die for and my go-to drink the the passionfruit mojito! 

Will not dissapoint!

The food was delicious and the atmosphere was chill.  I really enjoyed it.  I compare all Cuban food to my mothers and nothing ever has come close to it until now.  Felt like I was eating a home cooked meal. I will go eat here again on my next trip to Vegas.

Gave them another chance today and much better so I'm giving another star. The mariquitas were fried fresh to order today; maybe you have to ask for them like that? Still not crazy about how they give you the bill but it was correct.

Came here for lunch on a Friday, it was my first time trying Cuba Cafe. After reading the reviews, I was excited to try it. We showed up about an hour after they opened and the service was a little slow. A few tables were filled but there were still many open tables in the restaurant. As people began to build up at the front door, we were all seated. Drink orders were taken quickly and after just the right amount of time, the waitress came to take our food order. 
It took a while to get out food out, we waited longer than we would have liked to. I got the Tasting Plate which has a sampling of 3 different meats with rice. The food was amazing. Everything was tender and flavorful. 
My coworker unfortunately found a hair in her salad after eating half of her dish. The waitress apologized several times and let her have her entire meal for free. We definitely did not expect that. She made up for the hair and the slow service by showing genuine empathy for the situation. 
I would go back as my experience was pretty good. This just isn't a place to go for an hour lunch break.

Yummy! I had been sent to a client's office nearby with a coworker and we were desperately searching for something to eat that wasn't on the strip. It was almost empty when I walked in with my coworker - there was only one table and only one other group walked in while we were there. I ordered the lamb chop tapas and platanos maduros, and my coworker ordered the bistec empanizado. 

The bread basket we got was warm and soft. I actually liked it better when it cooled down a little because the bread got crunchier. It was superrr soft  when we first got it.

My lamb chops were good, but not great. There wasn't a crust on it, and it was cooked medium instead of the medium rare I'd ordered it. I loved the plantains. 

My coworker didn't really like her steak, but that was because she's THE pickiest eater I've ever met and only really likes healthy food. Over the 3 days I spent with, I realized that she's just horrible at ordering. I tried her steak and it was perfectly fine to me. I kind of wanted some ketchup to go with it, but it was pretty much what I expected. Not too greasy and the breading wasn't soggy.

Amazing food! The ham croquettes was scrumptious, the tostones were absolutely perfect, and the moros con cristianos was superb! Best Cuban food I have ever had outside of my mother's kitchen. Buen Provecho!

Ordered Cubans sandwich & papas frittata. They were ok but nothing special. For that much money I don't think I would get to go again. To be fair I will try them again & eat in the restaurant. Wait staff was friendly. 
Food 2 star
Service 3 star

This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!  I grew up eating Cuban and Puerto Rican food (my favorites).  Wonderful food here.  I always get my favorites, Tostones, Papa Rellena( potato ball w/ meat in the middle) so yummy! They've also recently added Arroz con gandules (rice with pigeon peas) awesome, and Pastelles Puertoriquena!!  Omg I would eat here way more often if the prices were a little lower...soooo good!

Mala experiencia llegue un día antes del día de las madres mi esposa he hija ordenaron y ordené unas costillas pero venían acompañado de dos guarniciones pero yo quería cambiarlas por arroz de mariscos pero la señorita me dijo que ordenaría otro plato y que lo hiba a cobrar  ami no me molesta el cargo extra lo que me molestó la forma en que la señorita  me lo explicó me hizo sentir como que yo no quería pagar por mi combinación  bueno  ella no supo controlar la cituacion asi que llamó a un joven bartender creo pues no se identifico llego ala mesa sin saludar ni identificarse y me cuestiono sobre mi pedido fue muy antipático nada educado que decidí cancelar mi orden muy molesto yo  me hecho a perder mi regalo del día de las madres  ami esposa no lo recomiendo por mal servicio

Let me add something here.  Cuba Cafe' has some seriously good Cuban food.  There has been some migration of Cubans and Cuban-Americans from Florida, providing more choices in Cuban food to this growing metro area, and that's a good thing.

While I may stick to ropa vieja, my friend went with the vaca frita.  Translated, "vaca frita" means "fried cow."  That's not appealing, but then "ropa vieja" means "old clothes."  I got to sample a forkful or two of that vaca frita and I would make it my first choice for lunch or dinner going forward.

The service by the main waiter/server was quick, spirited, and on point.  There was some sharing of duties with someone who performed a host type function and took orders for drinks and any appetizers.  We did order some croquetas.  They never arrived.  While I often use the expression "on intravenous demerol" for people who appear to be checked out, I'd say this individual, despite being very nice, had some "deer in the headlights" stuff going on instead.  This turned out to be a fortuitous event.  Between the main platter and some flan, we didn't have any room for those croquetas, despite how good they generally are.

My friend told me that another excursion to Cuba Cafe' was undertaken solo the following week.  It was for the purpose of eating some of that vaca frita again.  I think I might dream of that vaca frita tonight.

I came here with a friend we were driving around look for some food and decided to give this place a try :) 

To drink I just got water but for food a got the churassco Cubano I'm 100 percent sure I spelled that wrong lol but it was flank steak either way it was super yummy  

The steak was cooked perfectly I asked for medium rare and they did a great job I was pleased 

I would come again but not sure when
Finally found a spot where to go eat and have my mojitos. A must if you're looking to eat some authentic Cuban food. It's the closest to my Puerto Rican food. Hit the spot plus Happy Hour everyday.

Came here while I was in town with girlfriends.  My friend is married to a Cuban mad so we figured we'd eat Cuban food!  To my surprise, my friend had already eaten at this restaurant with her hubby!  

I had ordered a beef empanada for appetizer and the Cuban sandwich for my main dish.  I really wanted to order the ropa vieja but had a bad experience ordering this dish with Porto's in LA.  

The beef empanada was tasty but a little too greasy for me.  The Cuban sandwich was great.  This fulfilled my sandwich craving.  The pork, ham, cheese and pickle blended well together and the bread was nicely done.  I had the opportunity to get a couple bites of the ropa vieja and I regretted the fact that I didn't order it!  It was cooked to perfection.  

I would return to this restaurant.  Service was up to par.  Only thing that bothered me were the flies that kept flying around our table.

Omg good food!!!! I've been wanting to stop in here for 3 years. 

So today we stopped in for lunch. The decor needs ton of work! It looks like it fell out of the early 90's. It would be so cute if it was updated. 

The staff was ok. Not overly friendly. Not chatty. I don't think I saw the girl with the long braid (our server) or he back waiter (tall guy with beard) smile once. But they definitely seemed to like the other people who came in. Chatting away. Ok I get it. We obviously stick out like a sore thumb. We asked questions about the food. Because my boyfriend has food allergies and we don't speak or read Spanish. Honestly if we had been made to feel more at home then I would have given this place 5 stars because the food was delicious! 

We ordered pineapple mojito, coconut mojito (had no coconut flavor), we had the sampler for an app. So good a little of everything. Not big. Not enough to split with more than 2 people. Then I had the taste for an entrée and he had some shredded beef plate. The black bean rice is good.  I wish I could tell you what everything was named but I forgot. 

Management should work on along people of all walks of life feel welcomed and at home.  That would have made a huge difference.

Great place to eat
I was told to check if out by a friend of mine 
And great surprise
Great vibe great food 
Not expensive and authentic taste
I also had the pleasure for take away ;)
Would always recommend and sometimes live music too ,,,ask

I've been here a few times, and I like their take on several of their dishes, notably the ropa vieja and the macitas fritas. Their take on macitas is a lot nicer than many places I've been, where the pork is kind of swimming in garlic oil. Theirs has a great mojo criollo flavor without the oil! I personally like the onions a bit less cooked, but that's no biggie. 
Both the maduros and tostones are quite nice as are the moros. 
No complaints at all!

This is one of my 1st times eating Cuban food and I have to say that it was a great experience. Our waiter was very friendly and helpful. The atmosphere was very nice and I loved the Spanish music playing while we eat. I would 100% recommend and will be back again.
Service is wonderful and the place is very clean Ropa was the best I've had. It comes with rice and we got some fried plantains.

Best Cubano sandwich, ever.

In fact, one of the best sandwiches of any variety, ever.   A sandwich I will never forget.  Like I won't want to eat one from anywhere else because any other one will suck in comparison.  That good.

It was a substantial sandwich: plenty big enough to share.  In hindsight, however,  I wish I would've ordered one all to myself.  Not that I could've finished the whole thing in one sitting.  I just would've loved to have whipped out the second half for a late night room snack.  

The key ingredient that made this sandwich so special was the roast pork.  It was simply the most perfect roast pork you could possibly imagine (and I'm giving you credit for an excellent imagination).  The sandwich was pressed, as Cubanos always are, and it was impossible to understand how much meat was packed inside just by looking at it.  But once you started eating it, it became clear that there was a hell of a lot of meat in there.  The sandwich was quite filling.

We started with an order of croquettes.  My wife thought they were just OK.  I thought they were really very good.

The other highlight of the meal was the house made Lemonade.  I have never had any lemonade like this.  It tasted exactly like the lemon dream pie my mom makes.  I have no idea how they make that lemonade, but definitely one of the most unique and one of the tastiest I've ever tried.

Mikey C says: Viva Cuba Cafe!

This spot never fails to impress!! Bomb ass food, reminds me of me dad cooking. From the arroz con pollo, to the pasta Cuba cafe. Authentic Cuban food. I highly recommend getting the bistec de palomilla, it is by far my favorite and don't be afraid to order an enselada de augacate...I love this place !!!

Cuba cafe is an OK restaurant, being from the caribbean ive eaten plenty good cuban food and i must say this place its just OK. I have to start from the service. We went there for lunch and they had a lunch special, Churrasco, this was at 12:30 when we got to the restaurant, it was fairly empty, only 3 tables were occupied, the waitress takes our order and we order two lunch special, she comes back after a while and says they only have one lunch special left, i mean this is 12:30 how could be out of lunch special at this time with an empty restaurant?, so i had to settle for something else, a cuban sandwich. We also ordered a tastting plater, the empanadas were very good but that was about it and the waitress offered my husband some chimichurri sauce to go with the fried plantains and we finished the platter and the sauce was nowhere to be found. Then our food came and it was alright tasting, my husband churrasco was ok and the yuca con mojo where somewhat dry. The sandwich was good. We also ordered some mamey shake which had a very strange flavor as if they used frozen mamey to make it.  When we got the check it was wrong so they have to go fix it. Overall the food is just ok, service not so good since they took long for everything. We went to this place because we saw all the great reviews about it and i must say i was disappointed.

Great authentic Cuban food, with great service. 
They also have live music on the weekends. It's a great environment to go hang the out with friends have some food and drinks.

This is a long standing love of mine.  It's a Cuban restaurant that is a cross of authentic food with an upscale presentation and higher standard of service.  Yet without a higher price tag.  Imagine if Nana had taken a culinary class.  It's in a 3 star neighborhood with 4 star food.

There are mainstays like toasted Cuban pork or beef sandwiches.  Plantains, bruschetta, croquetas and the lot are all there.  The other tapa sized dishes include 2 lamb chops that are so savory, shrimp and Mahi ceviche and a masitas fritas pork medalion with a nice texture to it as well.

As far as the mains you can't go wrong with the Lechon Asado, easily my favorite main.  So tender and dripping with some kind of delicious sauce with rice black beans and that really fresh tasty salad.  Mix all these in each bite and it may become a favorite for you too.

The Camarones Al  Ajillo is a Cuban twist on scampi lemon buttery sauced GIGANTIC shrimp with black beans and rice.  Better than any description I could ever attempt to give.

Not too fond of the Ropa Vieja.  A shredded beef and sautee'd peppers and onions. 
It must be an authentic dish.  It's not bad I may just be spoiled by the other courses. 

You can't go wrong with an espresso and a Leche Flan or Tiramisu for dessert afterwards.

You wont break the bank here and you will be satisfied.  I still taste the savory and decadently rich sweetness of the meals here.

#1 out of 3 Cuban Restaurants in Las Vegas!

Breakfast/Lunch:
Media Noche/Cuban Sandwich is amazing for brunch!

Dinner:
Had our first date here when I met my wife! We always have our anniversary here. **Strongly recommend the churrasco plate and the lechon plate for dinner. We always have the mojitos either virgin or alcoholic!! **

Thank you to the owner for bringing a little authentic Caribbean restaurant to the west! Always feels like a home away from home!

Mmmmm ropa vieja. The food here is on point. I really enjoyed it and, while I haven't been to Cuba or Miami, my friends who have more worldly knowledge than I regarding such matters have confirmed this is pretty authentic. The tostones and Cuban sandwich are two other things I'd recommend. It's a small place and I've always gone at midday just after lunch so it's usually not super busy. Give it a shot if you're in the area and jonesing for some tasty pork.
Great place the drink are to died the sangria was good and the piña colada excellent food had a great taste

Really like they're food, Cuban sandwich and medianoche were awesome, everything was
Great!! Can not say anything bad about this place. Tnkx for a great lunch and great dinner!
Great authentic Cuban food. Will be back and recommend all my friends to go. I had the Flank Steak but also had a bite of their Cuban sandwich.

I'm Cuban andI grew up eating cuban food and I love it. Upon moving to vegas I found this place and tried it out. Mid day pretty empty and the atmosphere was far from welcoming the hostess and the waiter whome appeared to be a owner or manager weren't very welcoming. But seeing as I look white I wasn't surprised, I always catch the cold shoulder in Hispanic enviorments. But besides that it was decent. 5 stars Soley cause it's the best cuban place in vegas and I love my cuban food.

This is the best kept secret Las Vegas has to offer at the moment. I am so happy I stumbled upon this place driving in the area to visit an aquarium haha.

I ordered the Tasting Plate for $14 which was way more than enough to satiate my craving for meat. Everything was cooked to amazing perfection. The dish included a salad, some rice, three types of meat, and some fried plantains? I gobbled the whole thing up and left very full.

With that being said, don't come to this place expecting cool ambiance or stellar service or anything. This is a classic Vegas establishment that you can tell has been there for quite some time. Feels very local. 

If you are the type of person who thinks food comes first, you'll absolutely love Cuba Cafe.

Pros: sandwiches are fresh and flavorful. The marcuya fruit juice tasted pretty fresh (but not entirely sure if it was).

Cons: server kept seating people very close together. And the table was close to begin with. Literally had to slide over to avoid bumping into the people at the next table.  The bistec empanizado was underwhelming and a bit overpriced. If I come back, it would only be for sandwiches.

No soy experto en comida cubana, así que no puedo asegurar si es fiel a esa nacion. Si puedo decir que es uno de los lugares con más comida 'real' que hay en la zona.

TIenen varios platos copados, que son un bienvenido respiro de la comida procesada o variaciones de hamburguesa que se consiguen en todos lados. Un plato destacado es un sampler de todas las entradas, incluyendo papas rellenas, batatas, arroz, y hasta empanadas! Con gusto a empanadas!

La verdad que recomendable. La atención fue buena, eramos un grupo grande y nos sirvieron muy rápido. Los precios normales para la zona, hasta diría que algo baratos.

Best CUBAN food ever. This place is a family owned restaurant that is super authentic.  We have made this our necessary go to place every time we are in Vegas. Get the lemonade,  tostones, cuban sandwich,  anything! You wont be disappointed!

We came for dinner yesterday and found this place delightful. We were impressed with the flavors and the very attentive staff. 
We had two of the tasting plates, which include ropa vieja and chicken and I ordered the ropa vieja. Rice and beans are perfect, and the salad was very well seasoned. I had to guard my precious platanos maduros (a generous serving of one of my favorites) from my chowhound companions. 
I had a riesling and my husband had a good but not strong mojito. 
I really really enjoyed the generous space between tables, for you get just the right amount of privacy, and I cannot abide sitting elbow to elbow with other diners.

One observation, which is easily reparable, is the lack of lighting for reading the laminated menu. It was dark in the restaurant. I can generally read well but it should not be required that a patron use a flashlight to read. This darkness, however, and the distance between tables, makes for a very nice intimacy. This was a very nice experience, and especially remarkable as my husband, a really tough reviewer, really enjoyed the meal.

I have two complaints 
I ordered a ropa vieja and it was FLAVORLESS and the lechon was HORRIBLE !!! It had soo many salt and full of grease that I had to leave it on the plate. THE only thing I liked was the bread with butter which was delicious but I would most definitely not be coming here again when I come to Vegas. Please stay away from this pricey place !!

Camarones al mango. Cuban sandwich. Cold sliced pork with lemon, garlic, olive oil. 

So stuffed and satisfied. Don't be deceived by the outside of this restaurant. It's really cute inside and the food is yummy. Cuban sandwich was enough for two meals for me. Camarones were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The cold sliced pork was a little too slimy for me. But that's okay... I'll go back again and order something else.

The inside dining room isn't very big but I think it'd make a great private party venue for a group less than 25.

Better places including Bahama Mama's ordered three Cuban sandwiches, took a half hour to make them because there was only one Panini Press. Rice and beans was not edible. Food looked OK, but even though I like Cuban this is not a place I would go to again. And it is only a quarter mile from my home.
Love their pan con bistec sandwich. Friendly service. Price is pretty good too.

This review is coming from a Cuban couple who was raised eating Cuban food .........the media noche was soggy , the pan con ropa vieja was bland and thin hardly any meat, the Cuban pizza tasted just like dough .......the table cloth smelled like oil was spilled on it and they didn't wash it well. Our food took 40 mins to make it was only two sandwiches & two personal pizzas shouldn't have taken that long! The batidos (shake) de mango & mamey were 6$ ...... really was a disappointment never coming back here again. I rather drive to California to my moms or fly to Miami to eat Cuban food.  YELP MAKE 0 stars a thing because that's what this place deserves.

Went here the other night as we were driving around looking for a last minute place to stop.  I love the live band, it makes for a real nice ambiance.  I ordered the sampler entree and it was tasty enough for me to want to try more things.  Although the place was not packed on Friday night, our food took a long time to arrive, as did the delicious warm bread ahead of that.  Our waitress was apologetic though.  We need to go back so I can sample more to give a more complete review.

I stopped by on my way to the airport and loved it. The food was great and the staff were very kind. The live music was a nice touch. What would've made it a 5 is if service was faster, but overall would recommend coming for a taste of Cuban in Vegas.

I've been coming here for years, and so happy for them that they moved into a bigger place- but still in the same shopping center.

The pollo and camarones al ajillo are AMAZING. I usually get a pan con bistec at cuban places, but it's kinda dry here so I get the chicken sandwich and it's always juicy and flavorful. Ropa vieja is fantastic, the cuban sandwich is the best we've tried in Vegas (they use tender chunks off the bone instead of slices.) 

The coffe is INCREDIBLE, as is the tirmasu. It's cakelike instead of puddingy, just YUM. They also have a vanilla ice cream desert with warm strawberries and cinnamon- not only is it delicious but it's also perfect to share on a date.

Great food (and iced tea!) and service, definitely treat yourself!

This restaurant is awesome. Came with my family while on vacation. Was needing a home cooked meal after eating a lot of expensive junk food on the strip. This place hit the spot. Food was excellent. Staff was very attentive and service was fast. Being Cuban eating Cuban food out is hard because it usually doesn't meet expectations. However this place was great! We liked it so much we came 2x on our vacation. Friday nights they have live Spanish music. Great Latin Ambiance. The Churrasco was great and so was the bistec empanizado. Their avocado salad was delicious. Love it!

Sorry Cuba Cafe, you let me down. After experiencing Cuban food in Miami I was ecstatic to see there was authentic Cuban food in Vegas that actually had good reviews. I was so excited to reminisce on my Cuban favorites. The place itself is VERY small. I would say 10 tables max. When we walked in, there was a table of 7 or 8 people and the empty tables were all missing chairs due to the shortage. Apparently this place isn't used to large parties. Thankfully there were 3 chairs left to make us a table. 

Their menu isn't HUGE but has most of the Cuban staples. Ropa Vieja was a must for me. I could eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I even make it myself, however today was a day I would like to spend away from the kitchen.

We ordered the avocado salad and lamb chops to start. The avocado salad is basically just an avocado cut in slices and nicely arranged around a small cabbage and tomato salad. The avocados were tasty and soft but the salad in the middle lacked some flavor. I threw some salt on the avos and ate just them. The lamb chops (from what I heard) were very good. I don't eat lamb so I can't elaborate on this.

For entrees we ordered the ropa vieja (appetizer portion), a side of rice to sop up all the juicy goodness that comes with ropa (more on this later), a rack of lamb and the tasting platter, which consisted of ropa, a chicken dish and a pork dish. When the ropa came out, there was NO JUICE! :( I was disappointed to say the least. Every time I have made this or had this the beef was always swimming in that tasty juice. Because of this the ropa was pretty dry. The flavor was good but because of the lack of moisture I couldn't even eat it with the rice. The lamb chops (again from what I heard) were good. The spinach that comes with them, although good, had no real flavor. It needed some garlic or other flavoring. The tasting platter was good as well. The pork was fork tender, the chicken was spicy (just as my friend had ordered it), however she too stated the ropa was a little dry for her taste. 

For dessert we ordered tres leches, flan and guava with cream cheese. The tres leches tasted like store bought pound cake that had been soaked in milk. The flan actually tasted more like tres leches than the real thing. I am not a flan fan because of its texture but this was a little stiffer and more like a cheesecake. The guava with cream cheese was swimming in a sweet sauce and not what I was used to. I am not familiar with the authentic presentation of this dish, however when I dined in little cuba in Tampa, it was always served as a slice of guava paste topped with cream cheese. This was more of a runny paste soaked in simple syrup topped with a line of cream cheese.
